headline: The Best Rolled Sugar Cookies
description: This is the best sugar cookie recipe; easy to cut out and they're perfect for decorating. This is the only cookie recipe you'll need for any holiday!

video.description: See how to make a top-rated sugar cookie from scratch.
video.name: The Best Rolled Sugar Cookies

name: The Best Rolled Sugar Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Cream together butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.
Beat in eggs and vanilla. Stir in flour, baking powder, and salt. Cover, and chill dough for at least 1 hour (or overnight).
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Lightly dust a work surface with flour. Roll out dough to 1/4 to 1/2 inch thickness.
Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter. Place cookies 1 inch apart on ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until cookies are lightly browned, 6 to 8 minutes. Carefully transfer cookies to a wire rack and cool completely before decorating.

The only thing I did differently was dust the countertop with powdered sugar and keep the dough on the chilled as we cut out shapes. Give it a go, you won't be disappointed.

This is the best recipe I‚Äôve come across for cut out cookies. Love this recipe and cookies.

These cookies are perfect if you're going to ice them! If you ask me these should be called shortbread cookies in order to better explain what the texture will be like for others who may be expecting chewy snickerdoodles. I replaced half the butter with margarine, which has a higher melting point than butter, and my cookies retained their shape beautifully with absolutely no spreading. I used minimal mixing of the dough in order to prevent them becoming tough, and added my flour a little at a time. This way I was able to avoid the dough becoming too dry. If the edges of this dough crack and split too much while rolling out, warm it in your hands just a little before rolling out the next batch, it CAN be too chilled! These cook very quickly! You really have to watch them, especially if your chosen cutout shapes have small or thin pieces. I pull them out of the oven at the first tiniest hint of browning and they are perfect with just a little bit of soft bite. I do recommend the extra vanilla for flavor, especially if you are replacing any butter with margarine. If you're not gonna frost these, sprinkle with coarse sugar before baking to make them prettier and sweeter.

I really like this recipe. The reason why it isn't a full 5 stars is because the dough is a bit too soft and crumbly, but it does hold its shape well. People on here are saying it tastes bad or is not sweet enough but personally for me it is, and I also tend to add cinnamon sugar on top to make it have a bit more flavour. I don't add any icing.
Super hard to make. Burnt easily. Tasted like crackers. Terrible cookies.

This recipe is fabulous! I‚Äôve been making sugar cookies for 20 years and this one is a favorite for cut out cookies. It is NOT very sweet. If you follow the recipe you will get a cookie that holds its shape for decorating and has a delicious flavor. It is very important to chill the dough or you will get a cookie that spreads and puffs out. Also, do NOT melt the butter. I softened each stick of butter for 10 seconds but checked it 5 seconds into microwaving them. I chose not to add any extra sugar to this recipe because I plan on decorating them with icing. If you are getting a dry biscuit tasting sugar cookie, you did something wrong. If the cookie was any sweeter, it would be too overpowering to ice. I have recipes that are sweeter and more buttery and I don‚Äôt ice those. I eat these with or without icing.

This is not a very sweet cookie without icing. It does hold its shape well and is very easy to work with.

I made it with the extra cup of sugar and extra vanilla that many reviewers suggested. The cookies spread way too much, not at all what I was looking for. After rolling, cutting and baking two sheets, I switched gears. I rolled them in cinnamon and sugar and made them into snickerdoodles. I probably would have been happier without the changes, but I‚Äôll just go back to my sour cream sugar cookie recipe.
By far the best recipe for cut out cookies. Cuts out and bakes up beautifully. Dough easy to work with if chilled. I use powdered sugar as needed for dusting which makes cookies plenty sweet
Thank you... just what I wanted for a good Christmas cookie, tasty, held together and great to frost.

This is probably the lowest rating I have ever given anything since I am not a critic. To be honest, I'd say the worst thing about this recipe was the number of cookies it makes. You should look at the yield on this serving. I had to halve, or even third the recipe. I don't know anyone who would have enough ovens in their home to bake 60 cookies. It is just overboard! The taste was good though, so I gave it a 3*. If you will halve it, the amounts are: flour- 2 1/2 cup, butter- 3/4 cup, sugar- 1 cup, 2 eggs, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp vanilla extract, 1 tsp baking powder. Overall a good recipe though.
This is the easiest and absolute best sugar cookie dough recipe I have ever used.

I found this recipe very good base cookie for frosting, didn't want the cookie itself to be too sweet. What I found interesting is that I got 35 cookies out of the recipe and I rolled it 1/4 inch. nowhere near the 60 that was listed and used regular sized Christmas cutters

Helps to keep the taste nice and bright instead of bogging it down with extra flour. A new favourite!

I have used this recipe for at least 10 years!!! Perfect! Not overly sweet (because buttercream frosting is sweet enough). Mine have always held their shape perfectly. I‚Äôm shocked this recipe would receive anything less than a 4 star!!

The flavor is great, but the cookies spread way to easily when baking and loose their shape. I've even tried refrigerating the cut out shapes and baking immediately once they are very firm and they still spread. This recipe is great for drop cookies, that's about it.
I have been using this recipe for years. I've found this one the easiest to work with and the flavor is great!!! Use along with Sugar Cookie Icing by JBS BOX

I‚Äôve been using this recipe for 5 years and it‚Äôs still the best sugar cookie recipe. The only thing I do is when it‚Äôs done chilling, I put flour and a bit of sugar on the board when rolling out the cookies so it‚Äôs a bit sweeter and doesn‚Äôt mess with the dough.
Unbelievable. These cookies are like manna from heaven!

I have used this recipe for years. I make sugar cookies for many holidays- at least 4 times a year. The dough is super soft. I will add different flavors to the dough itself or icing with extracts depending on the time of year I make the cookies. The ones pictured I made pineapple flavor. i love this recipe but add my own touch with tsp of nutmeg or anise everyone raves about these cookies and grandchildren help decorate even more fun then they gobble them down, love the Christmas seasons.

For those saying the dough is sticky - Make sure there is flour ON TOP and underneath of the dough your rolling, the first roll for me was sticky but then I put flour on top of the dough and it worked beautifully! They cut well, however they did spread slightly though it did not matter since I was making basic shapes. (triangle, circle, and square) However, that may have been because I forgot the baking powder AND salt because I was too focused on the flour. üòÑ Overall, wonderful and delicious cookie!

I've made these sugar cookies at least a dozen times. It is a versatile dough for rolling out and making festive shapes. I have used different extracts besides vanilla including lemon, almond and maple is great for Thanksgiving leaf cookie cutters. Adding citrus zest also enhances the flavor of these cookies. I have used royal icing on baked cold cookies to decorate or a baste of egg white and sugar crystals before baking. One thing I have learned that is crucial in baking anything is measuring accurately. In order to be positive you're being accurate I have found a scale to be invaluable. This recipe assumes you are cutting out 2 inch shapes therefore the time in the oven is accurate. If you are using four inch cookie cutters extend that time to 12 to 13 minutes.
They were really fun and easy to make. They were delicious at the start and then went stale 2 days after. ={
The best cookie recipe I've used!
Best sugar cookie recipe I've every tried!

Absolutely the best sugar cookies ever. I bring these cookies time every thing from theater to robotics or for birthdays. I usually add chocolate chips to make the chocolate chip cookies but them still cut the into shapes. I don't have a real measurement for that but whatever you thjnklooks right.

So perfect making a second batch today. These cookies turned out beautifully and tasted delicious, if your cookies did not turn out great using this recipe it is most likely due to you measuring something wrong like baking soda instead of BAKING POWDER because these taste great and baked perfect. I refrigerate my dough for a few hours before I roll it out and then refrigerate it again after they are cut out, I also put my cooking sheet and silicone mat into the freezer between batches, and only roll out 1/4 of the dough at a time. If yours are too hard you may have baked them to long. Every oven is different and have hot spots, if you have convection setting on yours drop the temp by 25 degrees and use that. Ours were soft and chewy but still held a beautiful shape and didn't fall apart when you picked them up to eat them, and if you are having a problem with your dough being crumbly when you go to roll it out work it with your hands until its not crumbly, cut them out and stick them back in the fridge and go directly from the fridge to the oven.

Pretty good! I didn‚Äôt make any modifications because I hadn‚Äôt read the negative reviews and I lack experience in baking, and these turned out nice! They kept their shape (such as a horse or duck shape), and they taste good. I would probably add more sugar or vanilla as they lack some flavour, but they‚Äôd be perfect with icing. I‚Äôd recommend halving and giving it a try before using five cups of flour when it might not work for you. And try them with milk!

I hate to say this but this recipe is better than my grandmas. I've used my grandmas recipe for 50 years. The next 20 years...hopefully, I'll be using this one. Delicious and buttery. I cut out my shapes and then ball up the leftovers and put it in the freezer to set up. Id pull that out of the freezer and reroll once it hardens some.

I have been using this recipe for several years, and have made it many times. It really is "The Best Rolled Sugar Cookie." Easy to make and the dough rolls out and cuts with ease. I have also frozen the dough, thawed, rolled out, cut and baked months later and it was just as good. Highly recommended..

This recipe worked beautifully for cookie cutters! And they taste great too! I highly recommend reading the tips that are listed above the recipe, because the recipes steps don't have a lot of detail. I found it easy to roll the dough on wax paper with just a little bit of flour.

I just wanted to say thank you J Saunders for making the best sugar cookies I‚Äôve ever had. Every time I make this recipe, and I‚Äôve probably made them over 500 times, everybody goes nuts. The only thing I can think is maybe the people who said they didn't turn out good accidentally skipped an ingredient or didn't follow instructions...if you follow instructions and do ingredients as listed they turn out perfectly. Seriously just try them and follow instructions ‚ô° We made buttercream frosting for the top, added a little sprinkles and confetti chips. Just try them they're great! My new go to recipe for all sugar cookies now hands down!
